abstract: Sanyo, the electronics maker, will sell its troubled cellphone operations to a rival, Kyocera. The companies said the value of the business is about 40 billion yen ($374 million). Including debt, the deal — set for completion April 1 — is worth about 50 billion yen ($467 million), although the companies have yet to agree on a final price. The long-anticipated sale of the unit comes months after Goldman Sachs and other investors saved Sanyo in a 300 billion yen ($2.8 billion) bailout.
